website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a higher level of convenience from your lock, but you don't want to pay monthly fees, then you'll want to give this deadbolt your consideration.
pros: The Yale Real Living Touchscreen Z-Wave Deadbolt features a sophisticated design, speaks three languages, and boasts easy-to-use controls
For basic lock automation, it does the job nicely, and works with a wide number of systems
cons: Like a lot of smart deadbolts, this Yale lock is pretty bulky, requiring a good deal of real estate on the inside of your door
Also, you won't be able to schedule temporary access codes unless you use the right type of home control device

customer_reviews.title: The low battery notification is very poor on the lock and we are locked out on ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of this product and it eat batteries. We called Yale and they had to replace the module on the first one. We then began to experience problems with the second lock. Batteries last less than 10 days in the lock. We placed a call to Yale on the second lock and they want us to remove the lock before agreeing to replace the module remove it from the Zwave system readd it. We already had to replace the Zwave modle on the first unit. It seemed to make the batteries last longer. The low battery notification is very poor on the lock and we are locked out on the unit. I would avoid this lock...
customer_reviews.author: C.H. Georgia USA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !
customer_reviews.text: I love this lock! This lock is hands down the best value compared to the numerous locks I researched! I receive many compliments on the lock and everyone wants one now. Update! It has been over a year - the lock is in direct sunlight most of the day and I've NEVER had a problem with the touch display (I was worried about the Florida sun beating on it all day) . Also, I replaced the batteries for the first time today and they weren't even dead yet. Update: 4 years old and still works perfectly! Rarely replace the batteries and get tons of compliments on this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonazing

customer_reviews.title: One start is for elegant looking and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 4 months for my rental. One start is for elegant looking and easy to install. It only works for a couple months and start having issues and finally I had to replaced it with the other brand. I can't unlock it with any pass codes I have. The battery is fine. I can enter my master code to change setting but the door will not unlock. I had to use the physical key to unlock it. My tenants call me several times for the same issue. At the end, the I had to replace it. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joy C

customer_reviews.title: Decent Deadbolt Design Flaws
customer_reviews.text: While this lock works well and looks great, it does break easily. The deadbolt automatically closes after 30 seconds (programmable feature). If the door is partially closed when the deadbolt tries to extend, the pocket in the door frame doesn't align with the deadbolt, which jams and stops. If this occurs periodically over time, the deadbolt mechanism eventually fails, and stops reliably sensing the deadbolt position. It must then be replaced. We've had one deadbolt fail in this manner. A second had a defective pin header for connection to a wifi module (which required replacement). Pretty decent deadbolt overall, but they are expensive. I'm not sure I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Petrofsky

customer_reviews.title: Good integration with Samsung SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: This is my third electronic lock. My original was the Black and Decker product from many years ago (and no longer produced.) My second, the Simplicikey, was great mechanically but suffered from poorly designed electronics. This product was purchased after I decided on using the Samsung Smart Things home automation system. Installation was straightforward and the voice prompts for programming were helpful. Battery life in my application appears to be in the 4-5 month range using Ni-Cads. Integration with the Samsung system was painless. I specifically was looking for a system that did not require a monthly fee to use remotely and this system fits the requirements.
customer_reviews.author: TXJim

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Hope the picking lock thing is fixed
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a shed with a thick 4'x8' custom door. Had to do a little shaving with a router to inset the door lock so it would attach. Definitely takes the 2-1/4" as advertised (1.5" stud + (2)1/2" plywood). I have tried the known paperclip unlock pick and it didn't work. used a whole variety of metal rod thicknesses with no avail. So either I'm a terrible criminal, or I have an improved lock. Very happy with the dead bolt as well since it's angled slightly, which helps with aligning the hole with the bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, Does not hold up to elements.  Customer service is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Lock seems like a good idea but poorly made for outside use. After about 1 year the lock finish is very worn out and the keypad is unreadable during the day, It should be made with UV protection. All attempts to replace have gone no where. I sent in the return documents twice but its just a black hole.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hate jogging the Coney boardwalk with keys that stab you ...
customer_reviews.text: Have that one person in your house that is always misplacing their keys?!? !!!Problem Solved!!! Come home drunk, and either lose, or forget your keys?!? !!!Problem Solved!!! Hate jogging the Coney boardwalk with keys that stab you in the leg, or weigh your pants down?!? !!!Problem Solved!!! The list could go on, and on like so many other reviews on here. So I'll keep it short. We've been using this lock for about a month now, and it's amazing! No complaints! Only thing I recommend is don't be cheap! Go out, and buy GOOD batteries because the ones it comes with are junk!
customer_reviews.author: New Utrecht Ave

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Zigbee Lock
customer_reviews.text: I started out with Kwikset Zigbee locks and those were junk. Very unreliable in terms of the Zigbee connection. These locks are fantastic. Settings can all be changed with the keypad, and the Zigbee connection has been solid from the start. If there is a negative, these locks are hard to rekey, but if you can live with that realizing you rarely actually need a key, you'll be fine. Of course its always best to have at least one key to one lock in case batteries die. the chances of all the batteries dying at once is remote.
customer_reviews.author: A N 3

customer_reviews.title: 3 years later it freaks out and randomly plays alarms
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this (without the wifi features) for about 2 months. It works really well. So far the original batteries have held up and haven't needed to be replaced. The only thing that should be fixed (and its minor) is that when you try to open the lock and you don't use the proper number of digits, the device announces that you didn't select the proper number of digits. Is that really necessary? Edit: it's been 3 years and the lock started randomly playing an alarm. It's probably some sort of tamper alert. The only way to stop it is to remove the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: grindMARC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a somewhat forgetful person, and there have been many times I have left the house and gotten a good distance down the road before stopping to wonder if I remembered to lock the front door. I set the "automatic lock" feature, which automatically locks the bolt after 30 seconds of being idle, so I no longer have to worry. Easy to install, configure and use, and looks great on the front door. I am anxiously awaiting the "Linus" version of this lock, which will connect to the "Nest" family of smart-home products.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Ingleright

customer_reviews.title: So nice not to worry about giving out keys to my ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed. I let another review intimidate me so I waited a month to install it. It took me, alone, approximately 30 minutes to install. Probably would take most people about 15 minutes. I set up codes for several family members already. So nice not to worry about giving out keys to my house. And I can delete the codes when I want. I love it. And if I"m right, I think CPI Security uses Yale for their digital locks.
customer_reviews.author: P. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: No z-wave connection to Piper.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, motorized deadbolt. Easy install and program. it also functions as a keyed deadbolt. MY complaint is that I cannot get it to pair with my Piper z-wave controller. It ALMOST JOINED the network, and now I can't get it to DISconnect, so I can try to pair it again. Yale Tech support said the controller (Piper) had to be within 3' to pair AND to disconnect. I tried that...no luck. I am stuck with the lock thinking it's connected, and with Piper thinking it's NOT. It would be nice to know battery status and locked condition from afar...alas.
customer_reviews.author: John 153

customer_reviews.title: it is nice to not have to get them out every time ...
customer_reviews.text: I am highly impressed with this device. It has not had a single issue yet. Though I still carry my keys with me, it is nice to not have to get them out every time to get in the house. Great for letting friends in to check the dog, or if they arrive in town early, or whatever. Supports dozens of passcodes. The device sits in the sun for the better half of the day, and has yet to fade or malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: alexandra bhatti

customer_reviews.title: Great Deadbolt!
customer_reviews.text: I love this deadbolt. I tried a Schlage, which I have nothing bad to say about, but it was too big for my door. So I never actually installed it. This one has a nice slimmer profile, and it fits perfectly without taking up extra ornate space. It works great. Simple programming. The video that comes on the description page was super helpful for installation. So far, I love this product and I can lock and unlock without worrying about keys now!
customer_reviews.author: TimBur

customer_reviews.title: Keyless entry with some annoying quirks
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Keyless entry. Bluetooth. Integrates with smart hubs. User codes can be longer than 4 digits. Cons: Sensitive touchscreen. Bolt alignment must be precise. Touchscreen doesn't work with wet hands or when wet (like when returning from a run or when it's raining) Bumping the lock before bolt has retracted locks up the unit from the outside. Usually takes at least 2-3 attempts to lock the unit from the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Carpe Cervisia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my family. Easy to set the code and change. Has saved us from lost keys and kids being locked out. Looks good. Not too bulky. I only wish it would tie into my Nest system of products but that may be asking too much. I will say that you can use this without the home automation system but it's not as easy. Much easier to use once you hook it up the the net but that part is a bit of a pain and you have to buy $100 plus product to make that work. I think it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: rexboyce

customer_reviews.title: Good but wouldn’t buy this version
customer_reviews.text: Good product but it’s hard for it to sense your hand when you put it in front of it in order to light it up so you can put the passcode, you have to put your whole hand in front of the lock so if you have anything in your hand it’ll make it really hard, would’ve gone with the button version if I was to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jocimar

customer_reviews.title: Selected and installed the Yale and it works beautifully. A very attractive and well-built piece as well
customer_reviews.text: Originally installed a defective Schlage for my Smartthings hub. Had to return. Selected and installed the Yale and it works beautifully. A very attractive and well-built piece as well. Also, since our whole house is keyed for Kwikset, simply rekeyed the cylinder and all our keys remained the same for the family. Had to slightly modify the dead bolt entry on the door jam to insure friction free movement. This was not due to the Yale design but slightly off-center installation by my builder. Also, paired up first time with my z-wave hub! We love it.
customer_reviews.author: SteveW

customer_reviews.title: Great Digital Lock MINUS the reoccuring Fees
customer_reviews.text: No re-occuring fees for software to connect to your mobile devices ... should have done this years ago. This is fully connected to my "FrontPoint" alarm system(simply the best alarm system ever). I can monitor who triggers it individually if I choose so through text messages, I can set up multiple and temporary user codes(like for the pet sitter), and it will trigger an alarm if tampered with. The big plus on this is the light up feature that can be seen in bright light as well as the dark. Though the batteries have lasted well so far, they are easily accessible for an easy swap out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Works well so I don't have to give my nine year old a key or get up to let him in. I can give the cleaning lady her own code also. The only reason I did not give it five stars was due to a small issue with installing the lock. They do not make it clear that the inner piece has to be put in a certain way. If you put it in up side down it fits together but will not work. I spent way too much time taking it apart and redoing it before I figured that out.
customer_reviews.author: Old Mama Speaks

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality mechanical parts, don't buy this one
customer_reviews.text: The thumb latch on the inside of the door began turning hard (catching up internally) within 4 months and by 5 months we can hardly get it to turn open. Only after jiggling the thumb latch a lot will it open. When I called tech support I had to uninstall it and put it back and it still had the same issue. In order to get a replacement I have to take it apart again while videoing it and show it doesn't work when off. Come on, what kind of guarantee is this. Can't even get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G Macdonell

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: It jams from inside and you can not unlock door. You need to go around your house and unlock door from outside. Outside is always working. Good part is smooth and noiseless operation.
customer_reviews.author: Branko Bem

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup and programming
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup and programming. The audio prompts are wonderful when compared to other z wave smartlocks like the schlage which require more complicated sequences of codes to enter in the event you ever need to make changes
customer_reviews.author: MikeS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent operation, simple installation and setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this version and the Push Button version YRD210. I regret buying the Push Button one and have replaced it with a Touch Screen unit and relegated the Push Button lock to a distant, little-used location. Installation, programming, and use are simple and intuitive. The deadbolt has a long throw, tapered end to help it align with the strikeplate, and the whole unit has a solid quality feel. Haven't tested the Z-Wave capability yet as I won't have the rest of the equipment needed for another few months, but I wanted to be prepared. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Got lock with damaged battery and with missing Z-wave
customer_reviews.text: Product came with 4AA expired damaged batteries and missing Z-wave module. The item description says "Yale Touchscreen Electronic Deadbolt with Z-Wave", but it delivered without Z-wave module! I am very disappointed as returning item was the only solution!
customer_reviews.author: Saman P

customer_reviews.title: Z-Wave Module stopped working after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: After about 4 years, the Z-Wave module one day randomly became unavailable to my network. After a bunch of troubleshooting, a Yale tech support rep confirmed that I would need to replace the module, which is priced absurdly at $100. The warranty on it is only 1 year... this is not a component that you would ever expect to just randomly go kaput. I will not be buying nor recommending Yale products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: SHAUN M BAZE

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my security system
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock to integrate with my FrontPoint security system. I chose this lock over the Schlage lock due to concerns about dependability, and at this price point, I wanted this lock to last. It was very easy to install. It only took about 15-20 minutes. Once installed, I did have a problem joining the lock to my system before realizing that I needed to plug in the network adaptor. After that, integration went smoothly and took about 5 minutes. We've been using the lock for about a month without issue. Hopefully this lock lasts for the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, assembly and start up
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, assembly and start up. I originally had an arrow lock which is exactly the same lock as this one but the screen on the other lock failed (I was told that this was due to a defect). I decided to go with the YALE lock this time and so far I have not been disappointed. I was also interested in eventually incorporating the Z-wave technology which the ARROW lock did not have. Once I can afford to purchase the router I will write another review of this lock with the z-wave. I will also review again if the lock proves to be defective like my ARROW lock but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Firth

customer_reviews.title: password works fine. I tried many times to reset it
customer_reviews.text: When i installed the lock, i got man problem on it. 1, Cannot remove key when the lock is on unlock status; 2, Once locked, remove the key, can't use the password to unlock it, it got stuck on it, and even can't input the key/. The only way to get it back is to disassembled it. With key inserted, password works fine. I tried many times to reset it, still doesn't work. Wasted me 3 hours on it.
customer_reviews.author: Palm

customer_reviews.title: Nope! Not this one
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this if you want it to work with Alexa. It doesn't. And there is almost 0 tech support. Install was pretty easy, and the key pad worked. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Wife&MomOf4

customer_reviews.title: Beware, incompatible radio module
customer_reviews.text: After all the troubleshooting, turns out this lock requires the Z-wave radio module. It came with the AT&T radio module that only works with Digital Life controllers. The description says it works with Z-wave and yet the radio module is not compatible with Z-wave? Wasted time and money on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve Catipon

customer_reviews.title: especially if you connected with smartthings and recommended to get third parts smart app RBoy Apps to ...
customer_reviews.text: since I have babysat, and when my kids came back from school, it makes my life easier especially creating a gusse password and it working perfectly for me as expected, at resnable prices, especially if you connected with smartthings and recommended to get third parts smart app RBoy Apps to manage your Doorlock it great product and support.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and good looking modern design.
customer_reviews.text: Kids and I love this deadbolt. I never used this kind of lock and want nervous because the front door gets very hot during summer, trapping between the glass door and metal front door. So far no problem. I am a mom, was able to install it within 20 minutes. Kids are now fighting who open the door with their secret code! lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kaudi D

customer_reviews.title: Not a Z Wave
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews on here missed to mentioned that this is NOT a Z wave lock. It's compatible and you can buy the "z wave" chip and instal it later. The product overall is great but I still returned this one because I'm looking for the ZWave lock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best locks
customer_reviews.text: This is a great full-featured talking powered lock. From the outside, it locks by touching the screen with the back of your hand. It's not too hard to program from the touchpad. I couldn't find a feature to quickly delete all codes, so somewhat tedious to manage codes from the touchpad. The the version I bought came with a z-wave radio module that you plug into the inside of the lock. Z-wave setup took a while, but we got it working with a USB stick. Privacy mode is a great feature to lock out all codes from the inside, just hold the interior button until the lock announces, "privacy mode".
customer_reviews.author: jeNOLA

customer_reviews.title: I used this lock for a year and a half ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this lock for a year and a half and needed to change batteries 3 times. When the battery is low, the lock will not open the door, so a key is needed to be safe from being locked out. I bought a new lock that uses 9 volt batteries instead and has a manual turn so uses less battery power.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen not always responsive
customer_reviews.text: While this seems pretty cool the touchscreen does not always come on. the one with the buttons is a much better buy. This also goes thru batteries much faster but its the diffuculty getting the screen to come on so I can get in my house that kills me. good thing I put it on the back door so I can come around when it does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Wulfe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock to replace a keypad lock that malfunctioned. This is a very high quality lock that was easy to install and configure. It is able to link to z-wave enable security systems. I have an issue linking to my alarm system where the lock is not fully recognized. However, I think I can resolve this with a call to the alarm company. The lock has voice driven menus that made set up a breeze. The motor that drives the bolt is very quiet, unlike other brands I have owned in the past. I would highly recommend this lock to anyone looking for a keypad like lock.
customer_reviews.author: Pixelated

customer_reviews.title: Works well, just not with the ADT Pulse system.
customer_reviews.text: The product works as advertised by Yale. The instructions are well documented, and the set up process is relatively straightforward. Some non-Yale, non-Amazon, non-ADT sites claim that the product, due to the Z-Wave technology, can be integrated with the ADT Pulse Alarm system. After sitting with the ADT technician and trying to pair the lock I found out that this is not the case. If ADT Pulse integration is a requirement choose an approved ADT lock, unfortunately none of the currently approved locks look as good as this Yale lock !
customer_reviews.author: Andrew O

customer_reviews.title: Overall Superb - But Can Skip Reporting the Lock State
customer_reviews.text: I love the lock, one of the most quiet smart deadbolts on the market. Ended up having to return it, because it would not consistently report if the lock was locked or unlocked manually on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: TheOnlineAddict

customer_reviews.title: This device works well and links with my Wink. ...
customer_reviews.text: This device works well and links with my Wink. However, a year after installing, the non-metallic outer finish (gold color) has discolored and does not appear to be from use.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Scott

customer_reviews.title: I love it. You have to have batteries ready to ...
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for several months now. I love it. You have to have batteries ready to go and make sure you don't touch the screen as you are closing the door, but it is awesome! I have it connected with my security system and it lets me know when the front door is locked/unlocked and who unlocked it. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Liked it but the zwave sometimes has problems working with ADT
customer_reviews.author: R. Staten

customer_reviews.title: Works great with IndigoDomo automation
customer_reviews.text: I got this to work with my existing home automation systems. After learning about encrypted Zwave (which this device supports) I was able to get it setup quickly. Battery life has been good too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Poulson

customer_reviews.title: Expensive lock that is worthless after a year and a half. Out of warranty.
customer_reviews.text: This lock totally failed after a year and a half. Called technical support to hear that it is out of warranty and the only thing they can do is offer a discount on a new one. Have to call customer support to find the amount of discount.
customer_reviews.author: BBCM2014

customer_reviews.title: Sleek stylish and shiny
customer_reviews.text: Sleek design and easy to install. much more quiet then my previous lock which broke. Love the auto lock feature just wish you cold set the length of time before the door locks. I can't walk to my mailbox and back without the lock locking. Finish is beautiful. Packaging is absolutely horrible though. The carton arrive with all of the pieces rattling inside and one of the keys was actually bent.
customer_reviews.author: PapaSully

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. I have these at both my homes
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. I have these at both my homes. Easy to link to Zwave system. Glass touch screen doesn't show wear patterns like the push button models. I actually let a service guy in remotely when he showed his badge on my camera. I disabled the alarm and unlocked the door. When he left I relocked the door and reset the alarm. Works with AT&T Digital life as well as Alarm.com.
customer_reviews.author: MJK

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Honeywell Lynx system
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Honeywell Lynx system. Easy installation and setup. Four stars because the "fit" is very finicky. As seasonal changes expand/contract the door, small adjustments must be made so the deadbolt is _exactly_ in the right place. If not, there are "lock jammed" messages (although the deadbolt still locks).
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lock, real crowd pleaser as well.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a Veralite, and everything works perfectly. My only words of warning are that this is more picky than a standard deadbolt during installation, with regards to the whole size and placementon the door. If you're door was not drilled properly to one of the standard sizes, you might have a hard time getting this working. You can't "force it" in place like some non-electronic door locks. Not a problem with a lock, just my door.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit small door hole
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit smaller diameter door hole. Bought a Schlage deadbolt instead and the Schlage fits both size door holes. Seems like an easy thing that Yale should be able to do, and a pain when you are ready to install and it doesn't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Keyless Entry -- a Better Then Average Lock
customer_reviews.text: The lock is a bit cranky to install. I have installed three locks so far and the existing door holes had to be adjusted for one of the installs. Once installed, the lock works very well for its intended purpose. In bright sunlight, the numbers on the electronic key pad are a little difficult to see, but they are functional. I am using the locks with Vera Edge control hubs. For this particular hub, pair the lock before installing it into a door. You will be much happier that way.
customer_reviews.author: G Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Simple and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Love this lock. I installed this prior to having contractors do work in our new home. Great to be able to program temp keys and never worry about locking yourself out. I also used the keys that came with the lock to key a few Kwikset locks to the same key. Now the entire house uses a single key.
customer_reviews.author: A. MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Great lock, not great connectivity with Wink
customer_reviews.text: Great, sleek looking lock that works very well. Only issue would be connectivity with home automation hub. While it does work with the inexpensive Wink Hub, the functionality is basic - open or locked - and no settings can be adjusted. If I had a more expensive hub, might work a little better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wallis

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: The lock works as expected, but it has issues maintaining connectivity to my smartthings network and the web site to register and receive help doesn't render on any nrowser I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lafnitzegger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and program, but pairing to controller was frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the instructions I told my wife that it seemed too easy. It was easy. Programming user codes was a snap too. Connecting to the controller not so much. I did eventually get them paired. Don't know if the problem was the lock, the controller or the technology. Persistence is a necessity.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, one caution
customer_reviews.text: Easy programming. Easy to use. Looks good. Be aware that it extends approx 1.25 inches from the door. So, if there is a screen door there may be a conflict.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Tarnished after 6 months of use on the front door
customer_reviews.text: After owning it about 6 months the brass is tarnished and it has micro scratches on the other parts of the brass. This is unusual as there is no need to 'touch' the brass, only the touch-pad. I'm not sure why this happened. the inside brass that gets touched all the time has no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Fishstick

customer_reviews.title: Revolutionary.  Life changing.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Revolutionary. Life changing. The gift that gives every single time you are heading in and dont have to produce a key. NOT a security problem. NOT hard to install. A PERFECT product, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Buckley Fountain

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, it only took me about 15 minutes. It also looks great! I haven't had any issues with auto lock other people have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great Motorized Lock
customer_reviews.text: Great lock, easy install & fairly easy setup, there's a method to the madness.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Good when it does not break
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an identical unit on which the touch panel became nonresponsive
customer_reviews.author: HCS

customer_reviews.title: they loved it. Product works great
customer_reviews.text: We give this as a Christmas gift to my wife's parents .They were a little skeptical at first but ,after installation ,they loved it .Product works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a great product, you will never be locked out of ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product, you will never be locked out of your home again. and very easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Donna  B

customer_reviews.title: Good Lock but lacks features
customer_reviews.text: Works , no instructions to set delay for lock, no feature to set lock to night mode or other.
customer_reviews.author: menodude

customer_reviews.title: I love this lock
customer_reviews.text: I love this lock, I haven't used my keys since having this. Easily integrated to my smartthings hub for security.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble! I love that it has multiple code options and is easy to program. The added key hole is a nice touch in case the batteries die.
customer_reviews.author: Nagnot

customer_reviews.title: These locks are fantastic. They look nice and function well
customer_reviews.text: These locks are fantastic. They look nice and function well. I really like the touch screen. I do wish the motors were a little more powerful. Any friction whatsoever in the deadbolt and it will error out and stop opening or closing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow instructions. They also have a YouTube video. Looks great. Paired to Frontpoint system and controlled through Alarm.com app on ipad. Only con is that it sometimes shows as unlocked even though it is locked if the handle us not turned completely.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: This lock needs a hub router, and the Z-wave ...
customer_reviews.text: This lock needs a hub router, and the Z-wave module in it to work it remotely. Be sure to buy all needed items.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Robinson

customer_reviews.title: so cool.
customer_reviews.text: So cool. My kids love it. I bought one for work and then bought one for home. I wish they were more affordable. I'd get one on every exterior door. I haven't tied/sync'd it to my Alarm.com alarm system and its app for remote unlocking, but I hope to do so very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Recommended, NOT only if you want to make you home a SMART HOME.
customer_reviews.text: this lock is good quality and good price comparing to other locks that will do the same as this one. very recommended. NOT only if you want to make you home a SMART HOME.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty Services Group

customer_reviews.title: Great for Special Needs children!
customer_reviews.text: I have a special needs child that loves this lock. He is constantly forgetting to lock the door after he comes home from school, and this locks itself after 30 seconds. Easy to install, program, and change. I just wished they sold it with the matching door handle.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Homie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent integration with my Qolsys security system
customer_reviews.text: Paired easily with my Qolsys security system, I can control the lock from the panel or remotely from alarm .com. Lock seems to be well built but I guess time will tell. Installation was a snap. I used a Schlage at first but it was not compatible with Qolsys and although I could control it remotely with alarm.com, It would not report correctly because of the Incapability with Qolsys. I'm glad I went with the Yale I love the capacitive touch screen, and motor is much quieter than the Schlage. Qolsys did a great job integrating this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Cos

customer_reviews.title: 110$ for zvawe connection parts and didnt fit my door ...
customer_reviews.text: 110$ for zvawe connection parts and didnt fit my door because front pad is to thick not fitting between two doors. so returned
customer_reviews.author: Mustangy_nyc

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I don't need key now. very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelio Gutierrez Jaimes

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This device is sexy. If it could be a boyfriend I would date it. Works flawlessly, easy to set up, and looks stylish. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lee Lee

customer_reviews.title: The lock I love it's connected and working great
customer_reviews.text: I received and installed with ease, I set up with a few minutes. The lock I love it's connected and working great. Just looking to see how I'm going to control from my phone. Nexia want $10.00 a month. I think Apple home is no charge through Apple TV. So far no faults.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This lock is awesome. I purchased after I got locked out and ...
customer_reviews.text: This lock is awesome. I purchased after I got locked out and had to call a locksmith at 3am in the dead of winter. This lock cost less than that visit. Looks sharp, does exactly as it supposed to. My son can get in and out with no problems...no keys to forget. Everyone should get one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Battery guzzler with Z wave.
customer_reviews.text: The lock works well. However, if you were hoping to use the z wave tech, be aware of the following: 1) Nexia, if it's your chosen controller, can only lock and unlock this, it cannot set permissions (days and times for codes to be active) or scenes. 2) With the network module installed, these locks are battery eating monsters. They last barely a month before they need to be replaced. In the end, I had to remove the network modules, because more often that not, the locks were dead. Since I removed the network modules, battery life has improved significantly, but it defeats the whole z wave thing, doesn't it?
customer_reviews.author: grasshopper619

customer_reviews.title: This lock had crap, scratches and film all over the screen
customer_reviews.text: This lock had crap, scratches and film all over the screen. It wouldn’t work, lock wouldn’t lock. What a scam and waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Operates in really cold weather!
customer_reviews.text: Works with no problem, installed by professional since it was for a new construction home but we set up the codes without complications. The cold weather here in Alaska hasn't caused any problems which was my main concern.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this lock!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup & install, looks fantastic in the door. Nice solid deadbolt. The plate you place over the hole in the wall was a funny size so we didn't use it. Haven't connected it to the wireless network yet but plan to. I think the only drawback to this is you have to have bear hands to operate it which is slightly unpleasant now it's winter!
customer_reviews.author: elle_J

customer_reviews.title: functional digital lock
customer_reviews.text: works great... easy install, love auto-lock and one touch locking.. I have now installed 2 of these locks on front doors within a month.. recommend them to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Collision

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for us. Have "portable" family that comes and goes from our home all the time. A simple call to us gains them immediate access to our home, even if we are 2,000 miles away! No need for keys or soon forgotten or misplaced codes.
customer_reviews.author: Regnal J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: it's worked and the detail looked much more better than the schlage I previous get
customer_reviews.text: it's worked and the detail looked much more better than the schlage I previous get. I love the screen too. Hope it will last .
customer_reviews.author: yy

customer_reviews.title: This is the best lock ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best lock ever! I love how convenient it is and I never have to carry keys again! The only downside I would say is, it does take a few seconds for it to unlock before you can open the door.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Love this lock
customer_reviews.text: Love this lock. Each member of the family has there own unique code. Locking the door with a swipe of the hand couldn't be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Coneys

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality Z-wave Door Lock
customer_reviews.text: This is the best quality Z-wave door lock on the market. It has the coolest interactive touch screen with voice prompts and futuristic sound effects, and the entire body is made out of metal. In stark contrast, the competing Kwikset Z-wave model has a flimsy plastic back without a touchscreen. This Yale model is literally years ahead of the Kwikset model. I love unlocking the door for visitors from afar using my cell phone, because the lock makes a futuristic melodic tone when it unlocks, and the touchpad lights up with the numbers scrolling in a cool pattern. Rock solid quality, and in comparison the Kwikset model looks like a cheap toy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Virginia

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good lock. It's perfect for coming home with things ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good lock. It's perfect for coming home with things to carry into the house; you can unlock it before you get out of the car, then just turn the door knob to go inside. Very good buy; great price.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and set up. Does what it is suppose to do. One less key to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: D. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and I don't have to carry keys to my house anymore. It's the little things...
customer_reviews.author: Russell J.

customer_reviews.title: It's just what we needed. My brother forgets his ...
customer_reviews.text: It's just what we needed. My brother forgets his key at home. So this helps if we don't lock the bottom lock.
customer_reviews.author: khari

customer_reviews.title: Great lock, easy installed, works exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Stellar product. Easy install, looks great, and after about 3 months, batteries are still going strong. Remote features work perfectly with a Samsung SmartThings hub.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Finch

customer_reviews.title: Yale over Schlage for sure...
customer_reviews.text: After having a horrible experience with my Schlage connect I picked up this Yale. It has been amazing so far. Setup was a breeze it even feels a lot stronger and better constructed. Looks great too! I have a Samsung SmartThings Hub with Alexa voice control.
customer_reviews.author: Walt G

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, high quality unit
customer_reviews.text: It was simple to install and pair with my Mi casa verde 3 controller. One MINOR nit -- and I'm not knocking off a star for this because it's not really the product's fault -- is that the rectangular shape of the unit doesn't quite give enough "coverage" at the bottom to hide the original deadbolt's impression into my wooden door. So I had to sand, apply wood filler, sand, and paint my whole door again -- just for the sake of about a half-inch at the bottom ... and because I'm a perfectionist. Anyway, that all done, it looks GREAT on the door, and works very well. And it rather impresses folks who come to visit. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Gregory T Reid

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This unit was a breeze to install. It works well although the touch pad can be a little quirky. I would definitely buy this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich K

customer_reviews.title: I purposely locked my brother out when he got home ...
customer_reviews.text: I purposely locked my brother out when he got home after he was away for a week, it was hilarious.
customer_reviews.author: Garris Yeung

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Now my kids will never be locked out
customer_reviews.author: Bryan M. Dombrowski

customer_reviews.title: I love this door lock
customer_reviews.text: I love this door lock! We no longer have to worry about getting locked out and it is super stylish as well
customer_reviews.author: Raul

product_meta.title: Yale Real Living Keyless Touchscreen Deadbolt in Oil Rubbed Bronze (Standalone) (YRD220-NR-0BP)
product_meta.description:
Color Name:Oil-Rubbed Bronze| Style:Non-ConnectedSecure your home with this Yale Real Living electronic lock and enjoy the convenience of unlocking and locking your door using the backlit touchscreen keypad; you'll never have to carry around your keys again. Create unique pin codes for friends and family and remove codes whenever you need to. The lock is Grade 2 certified and backed Yale, one of the world's best known brands in the lock industry that's been securing homes since 1846, ensuring that your home and family is always safe. Upgrade with a Yale Z-Wave or ZigBee module if you ever decide to integrate the lock into your smart home. Modules sold on Yale2you.com

AMAZON.COM
Yale's YRD220 Real Living electronic touchscreen deadbolt lock adds a level of simplicity to home keyless entry without sacrificing any safety. Its interactive touchscreen and voice-guided programming make this an ideal deadbolt for any homeowner looking to add extra security without extra trouble. 



The Latest in Locking Technology
With an interactive touchscreen that can be programmed right at the lock, Yale's Real Living deadbolt is very easy to use and put in and even boasts voice-guided assistance. It can be installed with a screwdriver and fits in a regular deadbolt lock space. The lock's privacy mode feature allows for locking out all users, while the auto relock function causes the deadbolt to re-lock once 30 seconds have passed, and the tamper alarm goes off when the wrong code is put in multiple times. The touchscreen is also illuminated so not a strain to use at night. The lock has 12 buttons in the pattern of a standard phone layout, and it’s a snap to set up PIN codes for new users, adding an extra level of convenience to home security. The touchscreen is weather-resistant, and the voice guide can be used with English, Spanish, or French. 
A Host of Helpful Features
Yale's Real Living deadbolt lock has a sturdy all-metal exterior escutcheon and a motorized in-and-out tapered bolt, which preserves lock functionality even if a door isn't perfectly aligned. Due to its handy size it can go above a regular lever lock, and it needs no additional holes to be put in during installation. It has a modifiable volume so it can be set to individual preferences and a low battery warning, so there’s no worrying about security being compromised due to a lack of power. It can be used with doors that are 1-3/8 inches to 6-1/4 inches thick (1-3/8 inches with a special thin door gasket) and is available in three finishes to match distinct decors: polished brass, oil-rubbed bronze, and satin nickel. 

Dimensions & Warranty
Yale's YRD220 Real Living electronic touch screen deadbolt lock measures 1-11/32 inches in exterior depth, 2-23/32 inches in exterior width, and 6-5/64 inches in exterior height and weighs 5 pounds. It comes with a one-year electronic warranty and a limited lifetime finish and mechanics warranty 

About Yale
Yale is one of the oldest international brands in the world and one of the best-known names in the locking industry. The Yale history captures major innovations that have marked the evolution not just of Yale, but of the entire locking industry. Yale Locks & Hardware is recognized worldwide as a leader and innovator in the architectural hardware industry, with millions of Yale products used in over 125 countries. Backed by over 150 years of quality and customer-oriented service, Yale offers a complete selection of door hardware for residential applications, now including Yale Real Living as part of the new digital home. It’s keyless entry made easy. 

What's in the Box
One Yale YRD220 Real Living electronic touch screen deadbolt lock, installation and programming instructions, quickstart guide, 4 AA batteries. 






FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Secure your home with the most well-known brand in the door locking industry, Yale. Enjoy security and peace of mind knowing your doors are secured by one of the longest standing lock companies. Our Yale Real Living products are backed by a lifetime warranty for finish and mechanics.

See more
feature_bullets: Replaces existing deadbolt with just a screwdriver. Requires a face bore hole of 2-1/8", backset of 2-3/8" or 2-3/4". Fits on standard doors 1 3/8" to 2 1/4" thick
Upgradeable to work with your smart home (including SmartThings and Wink) with Yale network module (sold separately)
Voice guided assistance, privacy mode, auto re-lock and more!
Voted #1 Smart Door Lock brand for 2017 by CEPro
Unlock by entering your 4-8 digit PIN code on the backlit, touchscreen keypad or using your physical key

specifications.Warranty Description: 1 year for electronic and lifetime limited warranty for finish and mechanical operation.
